title: RAMPANT LEVELING BOTS IN ARAM
body:
Recently i have been on a IP grind, therefore i play a couple of ARAM games to get the IP to where it needs to be or sometimes i just play ARAM for practice before a match, But recently i have encountered numerous no. of levelling bots, I know that it isnt hard to win with these bots but it still ruins the point of the game, It has gotten so BAD that i had 4 bots on my team and the opponent team also had 4 bots, It was basically a 1v1 with bots feeding you. XD, But i request any players that encounter bots in ARAM or The Rift to please report them.

P.S: If you're wondering how exactly u identify them is Leveling bots is they either have no keystone mastery, Have rarely used summoner spells, AA the minions until they see the champ which then the follow to just use all their abilities on, Buy random items that wouldnt make sense

replies.body: Bruh I feel your pain! The best way to combat bots is the make sure you're reporting them each in the post-game lobby. With those reports through the client, we can pull the game that was reported as well and build a stronger case towards punishments. Without any hard data like the match they were in, it's kinda hard to take action.

I got you fam. I'll report everyone of these cockroaches

They are hilariously easy to spot. Reporting shouldn't even be necessary. I could probably use the API to make an automated system that can instantly detect like 90% of them with almost no false positives.

Yep, I think most of them just push the wave- like doesn't move backwards at all. If there is a way of tracking that it should be easy. 

And yes, it's sooooooooo awfully stressful. You could argue that the result of ARAM games are somewhat decided in the random champ selections (as some champions are hilariously better than others in ARAM) , but when you realize you have a bot in your team= there is no hope at all. ZERO.

I will agree with total and I also agree with the rioter.
They are extremely easy to spot. 
Some run the same summoners like ghost and heal (Only for aram though, they run other things for coop)
While others have certain patterns.

Alot of them just int like normal players so you will see alot of them go 0-20 or something like that but now alot of the bots are changing their methods

Still some of the easy to spot ones but there are some harder to detect ones.



____________




Ex. 
Theres a bot in COOP that caught my interest.

Its a jungle bot

And they start gromp level 1

But stare at it.

Then attempt to kill it

Execute 

Then do it again

Execute. 

Which Is a little weird if it was one person

But then I noticed it alot across several bots games to know its a bot pattern. 

So the bot programs are getting updates it seems. 
Because if I didn't play coop that much, I as a player who didn't play it would not assume this was  a bot but a player because he didn't run it down. 


This bot has come into play this year because I haven't seen it before. 

______________________________

So regardless if its easy to spot.

It still is best to report them just to send a flag into the system for review.

Cause there are some bots that are alot more difficult to detect.
